item.title: Those new service sector jobs
item.description:
Sarah Osment on Twitter

‚Äúsaw a job advertised in 2016 for a millennial governess: 6 days/week, 12 hrs/day. 100k + benefits + manhattan apt. duties: live-in tutor/nanny/part-time chef/maid/dogwalker & advisor to family ancestry project (???). ivy phd required.‚Äù

item.title: Steven Pinker: The Blank Slate 20+ years later
item.description:
Listen now (67 min) | Twenty-one years ago, Steven Pinker‚Äôs The Blank Slate: The Modern Denial of Human Nature was published. A finalist for the Pulitzer Prize, The Blank Slate firmly established Pinker as one of the major public intellectuals in 21st-century America; it followed earlier works more narrowly focused on his discipline of psycholinguistics‚Ä¶

URL: https://razib.substack.com/p/steven-pinker-the-blank-slate-20?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: Links to Consider, 3/24

item.title: Chapter 8 - Marriage is Good (and concluding remarks)
item.description:
Previous Entry - People Are Not Products One of the things that I have learned to appreciate about Louise Perry is that she is self-aware and is not a humourless scold, a trait common to self-described feminists. We can see this in how she titles the conclusion of her book ‚ÄúListen To Your Mother‚Äù. This indicates a high level of self-awareness in which she understands that the resolutions she proposes are much, much more difficult to implement in real life at scale than to write down on paper‚Ä¶

URL: https://niccolo.substack.com/p/chapter-8-marriage-is-good-and-concluding?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: Links to Consider, 3/24
